March.","image":"https://s.yimg.com/cv/apiv2/social/images/yahoo_default_logo.png","keywords":["aapl"]},{"symbols":["AAPL"],"timestamp":"2020-01-22T00:46:00.000Z","title":"Apple plans new cheaper iPhone model: report","url":"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/apple-plans-new-cheaper-iphone-model-report-2020-01-21?siteid=yhoof2&yptr=yahoo","source":"finance yahoo","summary":"Apple Inc.  plans to launch a cheaper version of its iPhone in 2020, according to a Tuesday afternoon report based on sources within the company's supply chain. Bloomberg News reported during the extended session Tuesday that Apple suppliers plan to begin assembling the phone in February, and that Apple could announce the new device as early as March. Apple launched the iPhone SE, a lower-cost version of its smartphone, in a March 2016 event that was separate from its larger iPhone event, which typically takes place in September. Apple is expected to launch new 5G-equipped iPhones later in 2020, which could increase the price of those models. Though Reuters could not determine why exactly Apple dropped the plan. \n              The move shows how much Apple has been willing to help U.S. law enforcement and intelligence agencies, despite taking a harder line in high-profile disputes with the government. \n              Last week, Attorney General William Barr took the rare step of calling on Apple to unlock two iPhones used by a Saudi Air Force officer who shot dead three Americans at a Pensacola, Florida naval base last month. \n              Apple did in fact did turn over the shooter's iCloud backups in the Pensacola case, and said it rejected the characterization that it "has not provided substantive assistance."","image":"https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/Ci6BRENCb0dxBZiAYx.cYQ--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTEyODA7aD03MjA-/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/muRPVWKOai1iiKv9w9rJbw--~B/aD01NDA7dz05NjA7c209MTthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/http://d.yimg.com/hd/cp-video-transcode/prod/2020-01/21/5e2727aa99478571878423c0/5e2727aa99478571878423c1_o_U_v2.jpg","keywords":["aapl"]},{"symbols":["AAPL"],"timestamp":"2020-01-21T15:33:34.000Z","title":"Why Concurrently, Moody's affirmed A3 on $1.61 billion (inclusive of accretion) first tier revenue bonds and the Baa1 on the approximately $1.16 billion second tier revenue bonds.  The A3 first tier and Baa1 second tier ratings are based on the continued strong traffic growth on the system's roads, improving moderate total debt service coverage ratios that Moody's expects to remain around 1.7x over the next three years following very strong revenue growth in fiscal 2019, and no expectation of additional debt to fund the system's expansion projects.","image":"https://s.yimg.com/cv/apiv2/social/images/yahoo_default_logo.png","keywords":["aapl"]},{"symbols":["AAPL"],"timestamp":"2019-12-19T19:06:02.000Z","title":"Apple held talks to add James Bond, live sports to streaming service - WSJ","url":"https://uk.finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-held-talks-add-james-190602828.html","source":"uk finance yahoo","summary":"The tech behemoth's Apple TV app and TV+ services were launched in November at $4.99 per month with nine original programs, marking the iPhone maker's entry into the crowded streaming TV market.
